item.title: Detect Core Dumps
item.description: Core Dumps A core dump is a file containing a process’s address space (memory) when the process terminates unexpectedly. Core dumps may be produced on-demand (such as by a debugger), or automatically upon termination. Core dumps are triggered by the kernel in response to program crashes, and may be passed to a helper program (such as systemd-coredump(8)) for further processing.
